activity_desc: the action is simply mentioned and there is nothing being said about its completeness.\r\nIt is used to talk about an action which happens on a regular basis.
the action is on-going/ still going on and hence continuous. \r\nThe present continuous tense is used to talk about actions that are happening at this current moment.
the action is complete or has ended and hence termed Perfect. \r\nThe exact time when the action happened is not important and hence
the action is simply mentioned and understood to have taken place in the past. \r\nThe action started and ended sometime in the past but the time may or may not be mentioned.
the action was ongoing till a certain time in the past. \r\nThis tense is used to talk about an action at a particular time in the past.

activity_type: The Past Perfect tense is used to express something that happened before another action in the past.
The Simple Future tense is used when we plan or make a decision to do something. Nothing is said about the time in the future.
The Future Perfect tense expresses an action that will occur in the future before another action or time in the future.
